intro: Stenodraba chillanensis, commonly known as the Chilean narrowleaf sandwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of central Chile. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and linear, often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapted to the harsh, dry conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Stenodraba chillanensis is notable for its resilience and is often found in coastal and inland deserts of Chile.
